p: Treatment with the tested EOs affected the activity of SOD and CAT within tissues of the green peach aphid and the bird cherry-oat aphid. Activities of the studied antioxidant enzymes changed with treatment, time and the treatment Ã— time interaction ( Figure 4 and Figure 5). EO from S. chamaecyparissus significantly increased the activity of SOD in both aphid species after 24 and 48 h of exposure ( Figure 4). The application of T. patula EO significantly increased the SOD activity at 24 h in M. persicae, and at 12 h and 48 h in R. padi. When comparing differences between the oils, stronger induction in the activity of superoxide dismutase within aphid tissues was generally shown after treatment with the EO from S. chamaecyparissus.
